document.heading: District of Columbia Government Employer-Assisted Housing Act of 1992

history.narrative: Law 9-118, the “District of Columbia Government Employer-Assisted Housing Act of 1992,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 9-210, which was referred to the Committee on Housing. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on March 3, 1992, and April 7, 1992, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on April 24, 1992, it was assigned Act No. 9-192 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 9-118 became effective on June 11, 1992.
